data.title: Completely remove Gather4 from GLSL shader, fix conflicting tags
data.body:
Gather4: Since the actual functions have been removed, it will not work if it is enabled, so it can be completely removed.

Tags: In case someone wants to activate one or the other (I immediately ran into that problem :P).

data.title: Added FXAA 3.11 GLSL Shader
data.body:
Please review the shader because I am rather new to this.
(This is the first time I actually "developed" something in GLSL.)

It should work on older GPUs now, but I wasn't able to test it on one,
so I can't guarantee it will actually work.

data.title: Fix incorrect use of PODVector in ValueAnimation, maybe related to #361
data.body:
Indeed VAnimKeyFrame and VAnimEventFrame structures contains objects of types Variant and VariantMap, which may need to call constructors and destructors for memory allocation, so PODVector cannot be used here.
With this fix applied I no longer have any of the segfaults I previously randomly had while using animations.

data.title: is there exists a function to reset the ParticleEmitter
data.body:
Hi
I have a one shot ParticleEmitter, that is it's not looping.

When  it is finished, I disabled it's node. And then I reenable the node, and call the function ParticleEmitter::SetEmitting(true, true), but the particle emitter is not show again.

Is there a function to reset the ParticleEmitter?

data.title: The engine crashes when creating a CustomGeometry from Lua
data.body:
Hello,

I was trying to create a CustomGeometry from Lua, and it caused a segmentation fault. Here is the information I got so far.

The stack trace:

```
0   luaH_getstr ltable.c    456 0x709092    
1   luaH_get    ltable.c    472 0x70912c    
2   lua_rawget  lapi.c  570 0x4afabe    
3   tolua_pushusertype  tolua_push.c    59  0x6feb1b    
4   ToluaPushObject ToluaUtils.cpp  349 0x4ae952    
5   tolua_SceneLuaAPI_Node_CreateComponent00    SceneLuaAPI.cpp 4201    0x50ce76    
6   luaD_precall    ldo.c   320 0x702eac    
7   luaV_execute    lvm.c   591 0x70775b    
8   luaD_call   ldo.c   378 0x7030f0    
9   f_call  lapi.c  808 0x4b0252    
10  luaD_rawrunprotected    ldo.c   116 0x70238d    
11  luaD_pcall  ldo.c   464 0x703448    
12  lua_pcall   lapi.c  829 0x4b02db    
13  Urho3D::LuaFunction::EndCall    LuaFunction.cpp 89  0x59c12a    
14  Urho3D::LuaScript::ExecuteFunction  LuaScript.cpp   160 0x40e728    
15  Urho3DPlayer::Start Urho3DPlayer.cpp    178 0x401ada    
16  Urho3D::Application::Run    Application.cpp 64  0x407b4a    
17  RunApplication  Urho3DPlayer.cpp    44  0x401466    
18  WinMain Urho3DPlayer.cpp    44  0x4014eb    
19  main            0x9f0696    
```

I extracted the code I used in a simple script to make it easier to reproduce

``` lua
local gameScene = nil
local gameCameraNode = nil

function Start()

  gameScene = Scene();
  gameScene:CreateComponent("Octree")

  -- create light
  local lightNode = gameScene:CreateChild("DirectionalLight");
  lightNode.direction = Vector3(0, -1.0, 0);
  lightNode.position = Vector3(20 / 2, 30, 20 / 2);
  local light = lightNode:CreateComponent("Light");
  light.lightType = LIGHT_DIRECTIONAL;

  -- create camera
  gameCameraNode = Node();
  gameCameraNode.position = Vector3(20 / 2, 30, 20 / 2);
  gameCameraNode.rotation = Quaternion(90.0, 0.0, 0.0);
  local gameCamera = gameCameraNode:CreateComponent("Camera");
  gameCamera.nearClip = 0.5;
  gameCamera.farClip = 160;

  renderer:SetViewport(0, Viewport:new(gameScene, gameCamera))

  local customNode = gameScene:CreateChild('CustomChild')
  local customObject = customNode:CreateComponent('CustomGeometry')

end

```

data.title: Wrong file permissions in the source package "1.31/Urho3D-1.31-Source.zip"
data.body:
When unzipping from the source package, all the sub-directories are extracted as having file permission set to 700 (rwx------). On Linux platform, this would make the sub-directories only accessible by the file owner only, i.e. they are only accessible by user account who downloaded and extracted the package. This does not cause any problem for user to build Urho3D and run the shipped applications from the build tree.

However, it will cause problem when user try to install Urho3D into a local file system. This is because current build scripts assume the file permissions in the source/build tree are correct to begin with. When they are already wrong, the corresponding file permissions in the installed destination will also be wrong as the result. i.e. they will be only accessible by root account.

Did I miss something?

data.title: Accelerometer's Y axis wrong values at certain angle ranges
data.body:
There seems to be an issue with SDL's accelerometer Y axis (1).

Here are the Y axis (1) values for a given angle:
-180  0
-90   -0.93 (can't go beyond to reach -1)
0 0
90    1
90 to 120 -0.98 to -0.95 (should be declining positive value)
120   1
135   0
180 0

Steps to replicate: print JoystickState::GetAxisPosition(1) in update function for example 18.

I digged in source code but have no clue why this axis is bugged (X-0 and Z-2 axis work fine).

data.title: Accelerometer 180 rotation
Shadow won't render if using OpenGL forward render path.
data.body:
Shadow won't show up if I'm using forward render path with OpenGL. It works on OpenGL deferred render path. On DirectX it works fine on both forward and deferred. I already tested using Visual Studio and MinGW. 

Software: Urho 32bit with Windows 7 x64 SP1.
Hardware: Core i5 2500K with Geforce 660 with driver v. 335.23

data.title: Catch-up C++ samples (screen joystick support for lua and AngelScript)
data.body:
Note that samples using left mouse click on desktop (8,11,13,15...) won't work as expected with touch emulation. Also there seems to be an issue with TouchEnd event as touches are sometimes still detected while left mouse button is up (don't think it's related to scripts).

Simply pass '-touch' to the player's command-line to test on desktop.

data.title: When add Decal,show warning "Can not add decal, target drawable has no CPU-side geometry data"

data.body:
I have a crash when I try to change screen resolution on fullscreen in AngelScript. There is created crash dump and the last line in urho3d.log is 
[Tue May 13 23:54:46 2014] INFO: OpenGL context lost

Is this feature supported?
I'm on windows 7 and openGL renderer, 32 bit build
edit: the same happens when toggling fullscreen.

data.title: Catch-up C++ samples (screen joystick support for lua and AngelScript)
data.body:
Note that:
- screen joystick is disabled for AngelScript as loading  a VectorBuffer is currently unsupported.
- samples that use left mouse click on desktop (#8,11,13,15...) won't work as expected with touch emulation.

Simply pass '-touch' to the player's command-line to test on  desktop.

data.title: Lua binding for TouchState::touchedElement
data.body: Lua binding for TouchState::touchedElement needs a fix (state.touchedElement returns nothing).

data.title: Console and UI::Clear()
data.body:
When using UI::Clear() (which is useful to entirely delete a scene's UI in one single shot), the console is 'deleted' either (more exactly its UIElements are removed) and it can't get restored after.

I think console shouldn't be 'deleted', or at least we should have the option to preserve/restore it.

Currently only the cursor is preserved.
